tables.name: interest_configuration
tables.description: Comprehensive interest calculation and accrual configuration table supporting complex financial instruments and regulatory compliance requirements. Enables sophisticated interest strategies with multiple calculation methods and payment schedules.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Composite unique identifier object containing tenant context, configuration version, and any hierarchical structure needed for multi-tenant interest management.

columns.name: rate
columns.description: Annual interest rate expressed as a decimal value. For percentage rates, divide by 100 (e.g., 2.5% = 0.025). Supports up to 6 decimal places for precision.

columns.name: rateCode
columns.description: Reference identifier linking to external rate sources, benchmark rates, or rate tables. Used for dynamic rate updates and regulatory reporting.

columns.name: calculation
columns.description: Mathematical method for interest calculation. Options: SIMPLE (principal only), COMPOUND (interest on interest), COMPOUND_CONTINUOUS (continuous compounding for high-frequency calculations).

columns.name: accrual
columns.description: Frequency and timing for interest accrual calculations. Options: DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, ANNUALLY. Determines how often interest is computed and added to accrued balance.

columns.name: capitalization
columns.description: Schedule for converting accrued interest into principal balance. Options: DAILY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, ANNUALLY, END_OF_TERM. Affects compound interest calculations.

columns.name: dayCountConversion
columns.description: Day count convention for interest period calculations. Options: ACTUAL_360 (actual days/360), ACTUAL_365 (actual days/365), THIRTY_360 (30 days per month), ACTUAL_ACTUAL (actual days/actual year).

columns.name: active
columns.description: Operational status flag controlling whether this interest configuration is available for new product assignments and active interest calculations.

columns.name: lastAppliedAt
columns.description: UTC timestamp recording the most recent successful application of interest calculations using this configuration. Used for auditing and reconciliation processes.

keys.name: id
keys.description: Composite unique identifier object containing tenant context, configuration version, and any hierarchical structure needed for multi-tenant interest management.

tables.name: statement
tables.description: Statement generation and delivery configuration table managing customer account statements, regulatory reporting requirements, and document retention policies. Supports multiple delivery channels and customizable formatting options.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Composite identifier structure containing tenant context, product type, and configuration versioning for multi-tenant statement management systems.

columns.name: frequency
columns.description: Statement generation schedule determining how often account statements are produced. Options: WEEKLY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, ANNUALLY, ON_DEMAND. Aligns with regulatory requirements and customer preferences.

columns.name: day
columns.description: Specific day of the month (1-31) when periodic statements are generated. For monthly statements, day 31 will default to last day of month for shorter months.

columns.name: timeZone
columns.description: IANA time zone identifier for statement generation scheduling. Ensures consistent timing across geographic regions and daylight saving transitions.

columns.name: type
columns.description: Statement content and format specification. Options: SUMMARY (basic balance and transaction count), DETAILED (full transaction listing), REGULATORY (compliance-focused), CUSTOM (configurable fields).

columns.name: deliveryMethod
columns.description: Primary delivery channel for statement distribution. Options: EMAIL, POSTAL_MAIL, SECURE_PORTAL, API_PUSH, SMS_LINK. May support multiple methods with customer preferences.

columns.name: gracePeriodDays
columns.description: Number of calendar days after statement generation during which delivery attempts continue before marking as failed. Used for retry logic and customer notification escalation.

columns.name: retentionPeriod
columns.description: Document retention policy for generated statements. Options: THREE_MONTHS, SIX_MONTHS, ONE_YEAR, SEVEN_YEARS, PERMANENT. Must comply with financial regulations and data privacy laws.

keys.name: id
keys.description: Composite identifier structure containing tenant context, product type, and configuration versioning for multi-tenant statement management systems.

tables.name: limit
tables.description: Transaction limit and velocity control configuration table for risk management, fraud prevention, and regulatory compliance. Supports complex limit structures with multiple time periods, transaction types, and enforcement actions.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Multi-dimensional identifier incorporating tenant, currency, product type, customer segment, and configuration version for granular limit management across diverse banking environments.

columns.name: period
columns.description: Time window for limit enforcement and reset cycles. Options: PER_TRANSACTION, HOURLY, DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, ANNUALLY. Supports both sliding and fixed windows.

columns.name: transactionType
columns.description: Specific transaction category subject to the limit. Options: PAYMENT, TRANSFER, WITHDRAWAL, DEPOSIT, WIRE, ACH, CHECK, CARD_PURCHASE, ATM_WITHDRAWAL, BILL_PAY. Enables fine-grained control.

columns.name: count
columns.description: Maximum number of transactions permitted within the specified time period. Used for velocity controls and anti-fraud measures. Zero indicates no count-based restriction.

columns.name: totalValueLimit
columns.description: Maximum cumulative value allowed for the transaction type within the defined time period.

columns.name: perTransactionLimit
columns.description: Maximum allowed value for a single transaction.

columns.name: onViolation
columns.description: Automated system response when limits are exceeded. Options: BLOCK (reject transaction), HOLD (require approval), WARN (allow with alert), ESCALATE (route to review queue), LOG_ONLY (monitor without action).

columns.name: severity
columns.description: Risk classification level for limit violations, determining alert priority and response protocols. Options: LOW (routine monitoring), MEDIUM (enhanced review), HIGH (immediate intervention), CRITICAL (emergency response).

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Multi-dimensional identifier incorporating tenant, currency, product type, customer segment, and configuration version for granular limit management across diverse banking environments.

childColumn.name: customer
childColumn.description: Default customer-level limit configuration object that applies across all products unless specifically overridden. Includes base limits, customer segment rules, and fallback enforcement policies.

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Multi-dimensional identifier incorporating tenant, currency, product type, customer segment, and configuration version for granular limit management across diverse banking environments.

childColumn.name: product
childColumn.description: Product-specific limit override configuration that takes precedence over customer defaults. Enables tailored limits based on account type, risk profile, and regulatory requirements for specific financial products.

keys.name: id
keys.description: Multi-dimensional identifier incorporating tenant, currency, product type, customer segment, and configuration version for granular limit management across diverse banking environments.

tables.name: limit_link
tables.description: Limit association and hierarchy management table that links specific limit configurations to customers, products, and organizational scopes. Supports override hierarchies and flexible limit inheritance patterns for complex banking environments.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Multi-level identifier incorporating tenant, customer segment, product type, currency, and geographic scope to enable sophisticated limit assignment and inheritance structures.

columns.name: customer
columns.description: Default customer-level limit configuration object that applies across all products unless specifically overridden. Includes base limits, customer segment rules, and fallback enforcement policies.

columns.name: product
columns.description: Product-specific limit override configuration that takes precedence over customer defaults. Enables tailored limits based on account type, risk profile, and regulatory requirements for specific financial products.

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Multi-dimensional identifier incorporating tenant, currency, product type, customer segment, and configuration version for granular limit management across diverse banking environments.

childColumn.name: customer
childColumn.description: Default customer-level limit configuration object that applies across all products unless specifically overridden. Includes base limits, customer segment rules, and fallback enforcement policies.

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Multi-dimensional identifier incorporating tenant, currency, product type, customer segment, and configuration version for granular limit management across diverse banking environments.

childColumn.name: product
childColumn.description: Product-specific limit override configuration that takes precedence over customer defaults. Enables tailored limits based on account type, risk profile, and regulatory requirements for specific financial products.

keys.name: id
keys.description: Multi-level identifier incorporating tenant, customer segment, product type, currency, and geographic scope to enable sophisticated limit assignment and inheritance structures.

tables.name: rules
tables.description: Payment rails configuration table that defines the settlement networks and payment routing mechanisms available for financial transactions. Rails represent the underlying infrastructure used to move money between accounts.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Unique numeric identifier for the payment rail configuration.

columns.name: name
columns.description: Human-readable name of the payment rail (e.g., 'SWIFT International', 'ACH Domestic', 'Real-time Payments').

columns.name: description
columns.description: Detailed explanation of the rail's purpose, capabilities, and typical use cases.
columns.example: International wire transfer network for cross-border payments with same-day settlement

columns.name: status
columns.description: Current operational status of the rail. Values: ACTIVE, INACTIVE, MAINTENANCE, DEPRECATED.

columns.name: enabled
columns.description: Flag indicating whether this rail is currently available for processing transactions.

columns.name: rules_code
columns.description: Unique numeric identifier for the payment rail configuration.

keys.name: id
keys.description: Unique numeric identifier for the payment rail configuration.

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Multi-dimensional identifier incorporating tenant, currency, product type, customer segment, and configuration version for granular limit management across diverse banking environments.

childColumn.name: customer
childColumn.description: Default customer-level limit configuration object that applies across all products unless specifically overridden. Includes base limits, customer segment rules, and fallback enforcement policies.

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Multi-dimensional identifier incorporating tenant, currency, product type, customer segment, and configuration version for granular limit management across diverse banking environments.

childColumn.name: product
childColumn.description: Product-specific limit override configuration that takes precedence over customer defaults. Enables tailored limits based on account type, risk profile, and regulatory requirements for specific financial products.
